intro: Plocama calabrica, commonly known as the California plocama, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its foliage consists of oval, dark green leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems.
